Authors:
Chada Norphanphoun, Sinang Hongsanan, Eleni Gentekaki,
YI-JYUN CHEN, Chang-Hsin Kuo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
A new species of Phyllosticta associated with leaf spot of
Rhizophora stylosa in Taiwan
Keywords:
1 new species  Microfungi  Morphology  Phylogenetic
analysis  Phyllostictaceae  Rhizophoraceae  Synonym  Taxonomy
Abstract:
Phyllosticta species have a worldwide distribution and are
pathogens, endophytes and saprobes. Species have also been isolated from
leaf spots and black spots of fruits. Herein, we introduce a new
species, Phyllosticta rhizophorae isolated from spotted leaves of
Rhizophora stylosa in mangrove forests of Taiwan. Phylogenetic analysis
based on combined sequence data of ITS, LSU, EF1α, ACT and GAPDH loci
coupled with morphological evidence support the establishment of the new
species. We synonymize P. capitalensis (CPC 20508 and CPC20509) under
the new species, Phyllosticta conjac (MUCC0410) under P. capitalensis
and six strains (CBS 173.77, CBS 119720, CPC 17748, CPC 20252, CPC
20269, and CBS 123404) are unnamed species based on phylogenetic
analyses and nucleotide polymorphisms. The phylogenetic relationships of
Phyllosticta species are reappraised and suggestions are given for
future work.
